Title.name: Roast Beef with Rosemary and Miso

Recipe.Description: Browned on the outside, with the strong aroma of rosemary and garlic but subtle undertones of hickory smoke and miso. Juicy and pink on the inside, the meat positively glistens. This is a two stage cooking process. First we slow roast the meat to minimize juice loss, encrusted in herbs and aromatics for an infusion of flavor, encased in bacon to insulate and baste. Then we do a quick sear under high heat to brown the surface of the meat for that deep roasted flavor. We stop the cooking when it is just done to rare, and let carryover heat take it to medium as it rests.

Prerequisites.Prerequisite: Preheat oven or charcoal grille to 275°F.

Ingredient.Name: Fresh Rosemary
Ingredient.Notes: Stems removed, save one intact sprig.

Method.Step: Season the roast with salt. Rub the surface of the roast liberally with miso. Season the roast with cracked black pepper. Remove the leaves from a sprig of rosemary and stick them to the surfaces of the roast. Turn the roast fat side up and sprinkle with garlic slices.
Cover the roast with a layer of bay leaves and then lay strips of bacon over the roast so as to encase it.
Place the roast on a rack over a pan or skillet and insert a meat thermometer. Put the roast in the oven or on the grill and cook until the internal temperature reaches 133°F.
Remove the roast and let sit under foil for about ten minutes, turn oven to 500°F.
Remove the bacon and save it to make Baked Beans later.
Discard the bay leaves and garlic.
Return the roast to the oven and cook until the internal temperature hits 140 degrees.
Remove roast from oven and let stand under foil for another ten minutes, it will continue to cook somewhat due to 'carryover' heat. Meanwhile, make pan gravy.
Slice the meat, drizzle with gravy.
Serve with horseradish Mashed Potatoes and Green Beans.
